alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 10:15AM CST until January 26 at 9:55PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road affecting Harris and Fort Bend Counties. For the Cypress Creek...including Sharp Road...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Creek near Sharp Road. * WHEN...From this morning to late this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:05 AM CST Friday the stage was 164.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 164.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:05 AM CST Friday was 164.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain above flood stage this afternoon. Additional rises are possible. - Flood stage is 164.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 164.9 feet on 06/09/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Cypress Creek Sharp Road 164.2 164.4 Fri 10 am CS MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CST.
